info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida...
Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Franklin, Gulf, Calhoun and Liberty Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown.
* WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur at Douglas Landing and Willis Landing Campgrounds in Gulf County. The 19.0 ft level at Blountstown may at times not be representative of river levels in these areas due to tidal effects, winds, or local rainfall and should be used with caution.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EDT Monday /7:15 PM CDT Monday/ the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 18.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall early Wednesday afternoon. It will rise to 19.0 feet Friday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 01/22/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 300 PM EDT /200 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Calhoun, FL; Franklin, FL; Gulf, FL; Liberty, FL
